info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:52AM CDT until August 12 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT FOR ST. CHARLES...NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN AND ST. LOUIS COUNTIES AND ST. LOUIS CITY... At 452 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Glasgow Village to Bella Villa to Byrnes Mill to Villa Ridge, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... St. Louis, O`Fallon, St. Charles, St. Peters, Florissant, Chesterfield, Wildwood, University City, Ballwin, Wentzville, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Webster Groves, Ferguson, Arnold, Manchester, Creve Coeur, Overland, and Clayton. This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Scott Joplin Historic Site, Route 66 State Park, Castlewood State Park, Confluence State Park, Mastodon Historic Site, and First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 257 and 277. Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 185 and 191. Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 216 and 231. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
